session.title: Simulation for Professional Services Agreement
session.jurisdiction_note: Contract governed by California law with specific provisions for termination, indemnification, and compliance audits.

timeline.title: Contract Effective Date
timeline.description: Agreement takes effect upon COMMISSION board approval and notification to proceed
timeline.detailed_description: The Agreement becomes binding only after full execution and approval by the COMMISSION's governing board. CONSULTANT must commence work only after receiving formal notification to proceed from the Contract Manager.
risks: Work performed prior to approval is non-reimbursable
Delays in board approval may impact project start

timeline.title: Monthly Invoice Submission Deadline
timeline.description: Invoices due within 45 calendar days after work performance
timeline.detailed_description: CONSULTANT must submit detailed invoices including labor breakdown, itemized expenses, progress reports, and cumulative charges. Invoices received after 45 days may face payment delays.

timeline.title: Progress Report Submission
timeline.description: Written progress reports required with each invoice
timeline.detailed_description: Detailed progress reports must accompany all invoices, showing task completion percentages, interim findings, and any problems encountered. Reports must be in mutually agreed format.

timeline.title: Insurance Compliance Check
timeline.detailed_description: CONSULTANT must maintain all required insurance coverage throughout contract term. Certificates of insurance must be provided before effective date and renewed with 30 days' notice before expiration.

timeline.title: Final Invoice Submission
timeline.description: Final invoice due within 60 days of work acceptance
timeline.detailed_description: After COMMISSION accepts completed work, CONSULTANT has 60 calendar days to submit final invoice with all required documentation and final accounting.
risks: Loss of payment rights if missed

timeline.title: Record Retention Period
timeline.description: 5-year document retention requirement after final payment
timeline.detailed_description: All books, documents, and accounting records must be maintained for 5 years from final payment date or until final audit acceptance, whichever comes first. Available for audit at all reasonable times.

exit_comparisons.label: Commission Convenience Termination
exit_comparisons.benefits_lost: Payment for work performed to date only

exit_comparisons.label: Consultant Default Termination
exit_comparisons.benefits_lost: All contract benefits, potential legal liability

narratives.title: Ideal Contract Performance
narratives.subtitle: Full compliance with all terms and conditions
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT performs all services satisfactorily, submits invoices and progress reports on time, maintains required insurance coverage, and completes deliverables according to schedule. COMMISSION makes timely payments and provides necessary cooperation. Contract concludes successfully with final acceptance and payment.
financial_impact: Total compensation: As per Fee Schedule up to $_____
Full payment received for all services

narratives.title: Insurance Compliance Failure
narratives.subtitle: Lapse in required insurance coverage
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT fails to maintain required insurance coverage, either allowing policies to lapse or not providing updated certificates. COMMISSION discovers the lapse during routine compliance check and immediately terminates the agreement under Section 4.B. CONSULTANT becomes liable for all reprocurement costs and additional expenses incurred by COMMISSION.
financial_impact: Loss of all unpaid contract amounts: ₹500,000

narratives.title: Late Invoice Submission Scenario
narratives.subtitle: Repeated failure to meet billing deadlines
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT consistently submits invoices after the 45-day deadline, causing payment delays and compliance issues. COMMISSION withholds payments and eventually terminates for default after CONSULTANT fails to cure the breach within 10 days of written notice. CONSULTANT faces significant financial penalties and reputational damage.
key_points: CONSULTANT fails to cure within 10 days
Termination for default with reprocurement costs

long_term.label: Year 1 - Normal Performance
long_term.description: Full contract value with all services delivered and payments made as scheduled

long_term.label: Year 2 - With Penalties
long_term.description: Cumulative costs including base payments, late fees, and compliance penalties

long_term.label: Year 3 - Default Scenario
long_term.description: Maximum exposure including reprocurement costs, legal fees, and contract damages

long_term.label: Year 5 - Audit Liability
long_term.description: Long-term projection including audit findings, regulatory penalties, and legal consequences

risk_alerts.message: Insurance Compliance Risk: Failure to maintain required insurance coverage allows immediate termination without cure period. CONSULTANT must provide certificates before start date and renew with 30 days' notice.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Implement insurance tracking system with 45-day advance alerts for renewals. Maintain continuous coverage throughout contract term.

risk_alerts.message: Default Termination Clause: COMMISSION can terminate for any breach with only 10-day cure period. This includes minor administrative failures like late invoice submission.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Establish strict internal compliance calendar with 30-day buffer for all deadlines. Implement dual-review system for all contract deliverables.

risk_alerts.message: Unlimited Indemnification: CONSULTANT must defend and indemnify COMMISSION for all claims arising from performance, including unlimited defense costs and damages.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Maintain maximum available insurance limits. Implement rigorous quality control and documentation procedures for all work.

risk_alerts.message: Record Retention Requirement: Must maintain all project records for 5 years after final payment with full audit access. Failure can result in contract penalties.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Establish secure document management system with automated retention scheduling. Conduct quarterly internal audits for compliance.

risk_alerts.message: Work Product Ownership: All deliverables become COMMISSION property with no residual rights. Unauthorized use or disclosure results in contract termination and penalties.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Implement strict confidentiality protocols and access controls. Train all staff on intellectual property restrictions and compliance requirements.
